content:
• Tuesday, June 25, 2013
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) says the FDA has issued a list of observations made during...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) says the FDA has issued a list of observations made during inspection of its California facility. Some of the observations include changes being made without notification and failing to notify the agency about injuries. Shares -2.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • SYNA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SYNA +14%. MLHR +8%. AVAV +7%. HOMB +3%. VHC +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SYNA +14%. MLHR +8%. AVAV +7%. HOMB +3%. VHC +3%.
    After-hours top losers: APOL -7%. FIVE -5%. X -4%. AHH -3%. RES -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) says that, effective July 31, Kenneth J. Kay will no longer serve as...

    Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) says that, effective July 31, Kenneth J. Kay will no longer serve as its Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer. The company is entering into a six-month consultancy agreement for which Mr. Kay will provide transitional services as needed. During the interim, the company undertake a search for his replacement. Shares -1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • BCC

    Boise Cascade (NYSE:BCC) says preliminary Q2 EPS is expected to be in a range from $0.11 to...

    Boise Cascade (NYSE:BCC) says preliminary Q2 EPS is expected to be in a range from $0.11 to $0.21, below Street expectations of $0.43. The company cites index prices for commodity wood products declining more than 25% since early April for the miss. BCC plans to report Q2 earnings and host an earnings conference call on Tuesday, July 23, 2013 at 11:00 a.m. EST. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • AVAV

    More on AeroVironment: The company is guiding for FY14 revenue of $230M-$250M and EPS of...

    More on AeroVironment: The company is guiding for FY14 revenue of $230M-$250M and EPS of $0.35-$0.50 vs. a consensus of $245.1M and $0.47. Investors seem pleased, given how expectations have fallen. Backlog was $59.5M at the end of FQ4, -16% Q/Q and -36% Y/Y. A 51% Y/Y revenue drop contributed to a 1210 bps Y/Y drop in gross margin to 32.7%. In spite of the rev. drop R&D spend rose 29% to $9.4M. SG&A -13% to $14.3M. Unmanned aircraft division sales -56% Y/Y to $42.4M, EV charging system division sales -12% to $11.7M. AVAV +8.3% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • BXC

    BlueLinx (NYSE:BXC) announces a strategic restructuring plan, including the realignment of...

    BlueLinx (NYSE:BXC) announces a strategic restructuring plan, including the realignment of headquarters resources and a possible sale or closure of five distribution centers. In connection with the plan and previously announced change in leadership, the company expects to recognize aggregate pre-tax restructuring charges in its current fiscal year in the range of $11.5M to $12.5M. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) +14.3% AH after raising its FQ4 (June quarter) revenue guidance range to...

    Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) +14.3% AH after raising its FQ4 (June quarter) revenue guidance range to $227M-$230M from a prior $190M-$205M, which itself was well above a consensus of $158.2M; the current consensus is $198.2M. Gross margin is pegged at ~50%, about even with FQ3's 49.6% Unsurprisingly, Synaptics attributes the guidance, which translates into 40% Q/Q and 66% Y/Y growth at the mid-point, to strong mobile product (i.e. touch controller) demand stemming from many design wins. The guidance comes in spite of order cut reports for the Galaxy S4, for which Synaptics is a key supplier. ATML +1.3%. CY +0.9%. UNXL +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $54.1M beats by...

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $54.1M beats by $3.03M. Shares +1.05% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX +8.2%) posts a solid day after the company says that it's launching a new and...

    Zogenix (ZGNX +8.2%) posts a solid day after the company says that it's launching a new and enhanced version of its Sumavel DosePro Migraine Toolbox. The enhanced design highlights the importance of having the appropriate medication on hand to address the specific migraine attacks, such as those that cause patients to wake up or throw up, or require a fast-acting backup plan when migraines come on suddenly or recur.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY +9.3%) spikes in afternoon trading after Wal-Mart announces SolarCity has...

    SolarCity (SCTY +9.3%) spikes in afternoon trading after Wal-Mart announces SolarCity has installed 3.1MW of solar panels at 8 Wal-Mart and 2 Sam's Club stores in Maryland. Altogether, SolarCity has installed panels at nearly 150 Wal-Mart/Sam's Club stores in the U.S., and more locations are due. Shares were already trading higher, thanks in part to optimism about Pres. Obama's new renewable energy spending plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • TVIAQ

    Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov thinks Solazyme's (SZYM -2.7%) sell-off on Monday may have been a...

    Raymond James' Pavel Molchanov thinks Solazyme's (SZYM -2.7%) sell-off on Monday may have been a bit overdone. The stock sold off following news of a dissolved joint venture with Roquette Frères, but Molchanov says the headline report is neutral and may even be a positive in the long run. SZYM wanted to move more rapidly with scale-up than what Roquette was willing to do, which is which isn't surprising, especially in a situation when a large strategic partner is working with a smaller technology provider.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing's (BA +1%) leasing unit, Boeing Capital, announces additional deployments of its...

    Boeing's (BA +1%) leasing unit, Boeing Capital, announces additional deployments of its workhorse 717 twinjet. QantasLink, Australia's largest regional airline, will receive an additional five leased 717s to add to its existing fleet of 13 that operate across the country. The deliveries will begin in late 2013 after the aircraft are refitted with upgraded interiors. The Qantas Group has operated the 717s since 2002.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +12.9%) shoots higher as Jon Carnes' EOS Holdings discloses a 9.5%...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +12.9%) shoots higher as Jon Carnes' EOS Holdings discloses a 9.5% stake in the company. Carnes is better-known as a short seller (Alfred Little) who made a fortune uncovering Chinese frauds.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -5.3%) slips after saying it's closed a public offering of 4,312,500...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -5.3%) slips after saying it's closed a public offering of 4,312,500 shares at $19, netting proceeds of approximately $76.5M. The company intends to use the funds to progress clinical development programs for Androxal and Proellex.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • WLT

    Coal stocks (KOL +0.7%) enjoy a bit of a short-covering rally as Pres. Obama's climate change...

    Coal stocks (KOL +0.7%) enjoy a bit of a short-covering rally as Pres. Obama's climate change speech displays a similar stance toward the industry as has been heard in prior speeches, but gains don't make up for yesterday's big losses. WLT +7.1%, ACI +4%, PVR +2.8%, YZC +1.8%, PVG +2.4%, PVA +1.9%, RNO +1.6%, ANR +1.4%, AHGP +1.4%, ARLP +1.4%, BTU +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +3.6%) is back near its post-merger highs after Bloomberg suggests the #4...

    T-Mobile USA (TMUS +3.6%) is back near its post-merger highs after Bloomberg suggests the #4 U.S. carrier may be Dish's (DISH +2.1%) only remaining option if it wants to be a major mobile player, now that it has abandoned its Sprint bid. Stifel's Chris King: "T-Mobile is the only option left on a national scale. The pay-TV business in the U.S. is shrinking ... It’s not good being essentially 100% exposed to that.” However, past remarks (I, II) from Charlie Ergen suggest Dish could also sell its spectrum, if not the entire company. There's also the possibility Dish could up its tender offer for Clearwire, and use it as leverage for a Sprint partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +1.5%) enjoys a bit of a bounce after its investor day yesterday. Barclays...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +1.5%) enjoys a bit of a bounce after its investor day yesterday. Barclays reiterates its Overweight rating, citing two main takeaways from the meeting: volume growth pipeline/potential in both the mining and oil/gas businesses, a key differentiating factor for FCX vs. U.S. metals and mining peers; and debt reduction as a core focus. Nomura also offers a favorable outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -20.3%) is exiting the tablet market and will focus its hardware efforts...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -20.3%) is exiting the tablet market and will focus its hardware efforts on e-readers, the book retailer announces in tandem with its bleak FQ4 results and FY14 guidance. With B&N's tablet share having cratered and the Nook division reporting $133M in inventory charges for FQ4, the decision isn't hard to fathom. B&N says it will "continue to offer its existing inventory" of Nook tablets through the holiday season, and will seek out partners to make B&N-branded tablets. Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) must be pleased, given the overlap between the Nook HD and Kindle Fire's targeted customers, and the fact B&N remains a top e-book competitor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • GHDX

    Genomic Health (GHDX -8.2%) takes a hit today from a Goldman Sachs downgrade to Sell. Goldman...

    Genomic Health (GHDX -8.2%) takes a hit today from a Goldman Sachs downgrade to Sell. Goldman cites a number of catalysts, including an anticipated disappointing ramp in prostate cancer test revenues over the next two years; downward EPS revisions starting with 3Q; and competition in breast cancer will intensify beginning in 2H13.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • AABA

    User interactions on Yahoo's (YHOO +3.2%) homepage are up 25% since it received a news...

    User interactions on Yahoo's (YHOO +3.2%) homepage are up 25% since it received a news feed-centered revamp, says Marissa Mayer at the Web giant's annual meeting. Mayer also claims Flickr uploads have risen 4x since a May overhaul that included giving all users 1TB of free storage. Yahoo shares are closing in on $25 again, and (with Alibaba's help) are up 67% over the last 10 months. (Mayer's Reuters talk)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • FIO

    In spite of its recent Apple/Facebook issues, Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) can post 20% revenue growth...

    In spite of its recent Apple/Facebook issues, Fusion-io (FIO +7.2%) can post 20% revenue growth in 2013 and 30% growth in 2014, says UBS' Steve Milunovich in a note sending shares back above $14. Fusion-io is expected by analysts to post FY13 (ends this month) revenue growth of 21.4%, and FY14 growth of 30.5%. Shares outperformed yesterday after Western Digital/sTec rekindled M&A hopes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -1.9%) is all over the board today after being pelted with news-related...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN -1.9%) is all over the board today after being pelted with news-related issues. Initially, the stock popped after announcing it had struck a new antibody drug conjugate collaboration deal with Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) worth up to $520M, only to collapse on reports that it had temporarily halted studies of its Lymphoma drug Adcetris due to safety concerns over reports of pancreatitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSLR

    U.S. solar stocks rally strongly ahead of a Tuesday speech from Pres. Obama in which he's...

    U.S. solar stocks rally strongly ahead of a Tuesday speech from Pres. Obama in which he's expected to outline plans to effectively double the amount of renewable energy created on public lands by 2020 (enough to power 6M homes), and to impose regulations of carbon dioxide output from U.S. power plans. First Solar (FSLR +7.6%), which received an upgrade and a bullish coverage launch yesterday, is the biggest winner, but SunEdison (SUNE +5.6%) and SunPower (SPWR +4.2%) are also doing well.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 13 Comments
  • MRVL

    Brean's Mike Burton upgrades Marvell (MRVL +2.9%) to Buy even as he cuts his 2H estimates due to...

    Brean's Mike Burton upgrades Marvell (MRVL +2.9%) to Buy even as he cuts his 2H estimates due to concerns about weak PC sales (hurts hard drive controller demand) and a 2H slowdown in Chinese phone sales. Burton sees Marvell benefiting over time from "new products and design wins" for a list of products that includes solid-state drives, 500GB/platter notebook hard drives, low-end Chinese 3G smartphones, app processors used by Samsung and BlackBerry, Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chips, network processors, and 10G/40G Ethernet transceivers. The David Einhorn holding is up 58% YTD. Susquehanna upgraded shares last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • RIO

    Iron miners move higher even after Credit Suisse cuts its price outlook for iron ore to $103 for...

    Iron miners move higher even after Credit Suisse cuts its price outlook for iron ore to $103 for H2 2013 and $95 for 2014, adding that the risks to its forecasts are "predominantly to the downside." Rio Tinto (RIO +1.9%), BHP Billiton (BHP +0.8%) and Vale (VALE +2.4%) are a big part of the problem, CS says, as they are expected to produce ~75% of the world's iron ore until 2016. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • CBMX

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +59%. MEET +38%. OXF +23%. CRWN +18%. USMD +16%. ALLT +14%. HYGS...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +59%. MEET +38%. OXF +23%. CRWN +18%. USMD +16%. ALLT +14%. HYGS +14%. YRCW +12%. OGEN +12%. OPTT +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: DMD -21%. BKS -18%. MITK -17%. AVD -16%. FMAR -14%. SINO -9%. EDUC -9%. INFI -8%. GHDX -9%. OESX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TDG

    TransDigm Group (TDG -3.2%) says one of its subsidiaries is planning to offer $500M of senior...

    TransDigm Group (TDG -3.2%) says one of its subsidiaries is planning to offer $500M of senior subordinated notes due 2021 in a private offering. The company intends to use the net proceeds, together with an additional $700M made up of incremental term loans and cash on hand, to fund a $1B to $1.8B dividend payment. Separately, Moody's puts [TDG's ratings on review for a possible downgrade following the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +5%) provides an update on its proposed transaction with Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) in...

    InterOil (IOC +5%) provides an update on its proposed transaction with Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) in Papua New Guinea: The sell-down is progressing on schedule as planned, IOC signed a detailed term sheet with XOM, and IOC believes the best strategy to develop its resources is a dual-development path which includes XOM at its PNG LNG facility and an LNG facility in the Gulf province.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • KMDA

    Another biotech IPO coming out of its quiet period today is Kamada (KMDA +3.3%), being initiated...

    Another biotech IPO coming out of its quiet period today is Kamada (KMDA +3.3%), being initiated by a number of firms with an overall bullish outlook: Jefferies kicks off coverage with a Buy, and Oppenheimer with an Outperform. Both say the real story here lies in its development of an inhalable version of alpha 1 antitrypsin. Data on the European study will be available in January and should it prove successful, it will likely be transformative for the company. Separately, Morgan Stanley starts the shares off with an Equal-weight rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • ZNGA

    All of Zynga's (ZNGA +5.6%) games will be included in a games app created by Windows app...

    All of Zynga's (ZNGA +5.6%) games will be included in a games app created by Windows app store/interface provider Pokki, which in turn will preloaded on all Acer PCs. The news is providing a lift to Zynga's beaten-down shares - the company has been trying hard to lower its dependence on Facebook for PC game distribution and sign-ups.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSRO

    Tesaro (TSRO +3.4%) moves up after being initiated at Mizuho Securities with a Buy and a $44...

    Tesaro (TSRO +3.4%) moves up after being initiated at Mizuho Securities with a Buy and a $44 price target. Late yesterday, the company also announced it had entered into a companion diagnostic agreement with Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN) to conduct BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutation testing on patients who will be enrolled in Phase III studies of TSRO's Niraparib study.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT +14.2%) skyrockets after announcing it has received orders from 3 of the world's 10...

    Allot (ALLT +14.2%) skyrockets after announcing it has received orders from 3 of the world's 10 biggest carriers - 2 in Europe, 1 in the U.S. - to use its Service Gateway in 4G network deployments. One of the European carriers will use the deep packet inspection hardware (DPI) to monitor network activity by subscriber, device, and app. Allot, now the DPI market's #1 vendor (per Infonetics), has been battling with Procera (PKT -0.2%) in the fast-growing mobile segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • HIIQ

    Health Insurance Innovations (HIIQ +3.9%) gains as SA Pro's Nassarius Capital calls (embargoed...

    Health Insurance Innovations (HIIQ +3.9%) gains as SA Pro's Nassarius Capital calls (embargoed until Wed. morning) the slide in the shares from cautionary guidance and increasing competition from big names like WellPoint (WLP) "short-sighted and overblown."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • MACK

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (MACK +3.2%) gets a boost from Mizuho this morning, who initiated the...

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (MACK +3.2%) gets a boost from Mizuho this morning, who initiated the shares with a Buy rating and a lofty price target of $12 - which represents a 112% return from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • EOX

    Emerald Oil (EOX +5.8%) provides an update on well development: Its second operated Bakken well...

    Emerald Oil (EOX +5.8%) provides an update on well development: Its second operated Bakken well produced ~22.5K boe during the first 30 days of production, and its third operated Bakken well produced ~16.1 boe during the first 11 days of production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox's (MLNX +8.3%) InfiniBand hardware is likely being used in Microsoft's new $677M Iowa...

    Mellanox's (MLNX +8.3%) InfiniBand hardware is likely being used in Microsoft's new $677M Iowa data center expansion project, says Clal Finance's Jonathan Kreizman in a note that has led shares to take off. Kreizman observes Mellanox has been expecting major deals from Internet/cloud services providers, and stated on its Q1 call it sees major deals arriving in 2H. He adds InfiniBand's "special advantages" (i.e. high performance, low latency, quality-of-service) become more valuable the larger a data center becomes. Mellanox has long touted the performance of its hardware within servers running Microsoft's SQL Server database.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • WLH

    William Lyon Homes (WLH +2.3%) gets a boost coming out of its quiet period as home prices grew...

    William Lyon Homes (WLH +2.3%) gets a boost coming out of its quiet period as home prices grew at the fastest pace in several years. That being said, Citigroup and Credit Suisse both start the shares at Outperform with price targets of $28 and $29, respectively. Specifically, Credit Suisse cites the home builder's solid geographic exposure, expectations for 40% annualized growth in community count and significant margin expansion. JPMorgan initiates coverage with a Neutral however, saying its strong position in California and Arizona is already baked-in to the price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +3.9%) is upgraded to Strong Buy from Buy at ISI, which says HERO is the...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +3.9%) is upgraded to Strong Buy from Buy at ISI, which says HERO is the driller in best position to benefit from additional increases in rates for jack-up rigs in the Gulf of Mexico. HERO effectively acquired two jack-ups via the acquisition of a majority stake in Discovery Offshore; the firm reduces its view on 2013 earnings but says the deal should boost 2014 EPS to $1.02.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (VOXX +9.4%) takes off after SA Pro contributor Soldier of Fortune predicts...

    VOXX International (VOXX +9.4%) takes off after SA Pro contributor Soldier of Fortune predicts strong vehicle and smartphone/tablet sales will give a lift to the consumer electronics/accessory maker. The author also likes the strength of VOXX's brands, including Klipsch and RCA, and notes shares only trade at 12.1x earnings and 0.3x sales (or rather, they did going into today).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • AVD

    American Vanguard (AVD -15.1%) nears a 52-week low following its Q2 warning, citing weather, and...

    American Vanguard (AVD -15.1%) nears a 52-week low following its Q2 warning, citing weather, and subsequent downgrades by Deutsche Bank and Piper Jaffray; the latter says it is less concerned with the weather impact and more around lingering effects of delayed or possibly forgone orders, particularly in AVD's cotton insecticide and defoliant products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • P

    The integration of Pandora's (P +6.6%) service with in-car stereos from 23 automotive brands and...

    The integration of Pandora's (P +6.6%) service with in-car stereos from 23 automotive brands and 8 aftermarket vendors has led to 2.5M+ service activations, the company announces in a PR giving a lift to shares. Pandora also estimates over 1/3 of 2013 new U.S. car sales, courtesy of 100+ vehicle models, will have its service built-in. The debate over how much Pandora's rapid auto market growth affects Sirius XM (SIRI +0.5%) remains intense. Fast-growing mobile radio app developer TuneIn is also making an automotive push; Apple could do the same via iTunes Radio and its automaker deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 5 Comments
  • PEGFQ

    Pacific Rubiales (PEGFF.PK +2.6%) flatly denies a claim by former Venezuelan vice president Jose...

    Pacific Rubiales (PEGFF.PK +2.6%) flatly denies a claim by former Venezuelan vice president Jose Vicente Rangel that the explorer had a role in a politically motivated plot against the Venezuelan government.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • WLB

    Oxford Resource Partners (OXF +35.7%) says it closed on $175M of new credit facilities to...

    Oxford Resource Partners (OXF +35.7%) says it closed on $175M of new credit facilities to replace its previous term loan and revolving credit facility, extending its debt maturity profile and increasing availability. OXF says the refinancing "significantly enhances [its] financial flexibility and puts it in a stronger position to participate in a coal market rebound."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • MITK

    Mitek (MITK -17.8%) tumbles to $5.38 after pricing its stock offering at $5.25. The mobile check...

    Mitek (MITK -17.8%) tumbles to $5.38 after pricing its stock offering at $5.25. The mobile check deposit software firm is offering 2.86M shares, a figure that (based on Q1 figures) stands to increase its diluted share count by 11%. Mitek expects gross proceeds of $15M, and only says it plans to use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes, including working capital requirements." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • AMRX

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) CEO Larry Hsu plans to retire, although he'll remain in his position,...

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) CEO Larry Hsu plans to retire, although he'll remain in his position, and as a board member, until a replacement is hired. Investors seem to be pleased as shares rise 6.1% at the open. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival Cruise Lines (NYSE:CCL) splits the role of CEO and Chairman of the Board in a move that...

    Carnival Cruise Lines (NYSE:CCL) splits the role of CEO and Chairman of the Board in a move that will see Mickey Arison give up the CEO reigns after holding them for 34 years. CCL +3.5% premarket after earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Like parents try to calm an irrationally screaming child, central bankers have...

    Market preview: Like parents try to calm an irrationally screaming child, central bankers have smothered markets with soothing words about how they'll continue to keep the liquidity flowing, Fed tapering and PBOC tightening notwithstanding. It seems to have done the trick and the child is comforted, with U.S stock futures and European shares higher. Decent durable goods data have made things even cozier, although watch out for a data dump at 10 ET. The S&P Mini is +0.6%, the Dow +0.45% and Nasdaq futures are +0.6%. Later: Consumer Confidence, State Street Investor Confidence Index, New Home Sales, Richmond Fed Mfg.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 3 Comments
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) +1.8% premarket after Nomura reiterates a Buy rating and $38 price...

    Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX) +1.8% premarket after Nomura reiterates a Buy rating and $38 price target, saying shares are oversold. FCX is entering a "significant" growth phase within its mining and energy segments, which should result in meaningful EBITDA growth and deleveraging potential during 2013-16, the firm says, expecting copper prices to recover as China liquidity conditions improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) says the U.S. Patent Office has issued "the first U.S....

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) says the U.S. Patent Office has issued "the first U.S. patent from a patent family related to sialylated Fc-containing products." The patent was issued to The Rockefeller University and the company is the exclusive licensee. Shares +2.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • CBMX

    Premarket gainers: CBMX +32%. ETRM +6%. Losers: MITK -15%. BKS -10%. WAG -6%.

    Premarket gainers: CBMX +32%. ETRM +6%.
    Losers: MITK -15%. BKS -10%. WAG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • FTI

    FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI) +1.6% premarket after receiving a $1.2B subsea equipment order...

    FMC Technologies (NYSE:FTI) +1.6% premarket after receiving a $1.2B subsea equipment order from Total (NYSE:TOT) for the Egina deepwater field development off Nigeria. FMC's scope of supply includes subsea trees and wellheads, manifolds, installation tooling, flowline connection systems, and associated control systems. FMC says Egina will be "the largest subsea project to date in West Africa."

Digital content sales declined 8.9% Y/Y off of a tough comparable to last year and lower-than-expected devices in play.
